Text.Value: Leave.
He risked everything for those refugees. Doesn't make sense for one of them to kill him.
Lorgan's in the room behind us, with Sister Rose. Brilgor's buried out back, through the kitchen and the dormitories.
Thank you. It just - it doesn't make sense.
How goes the search?
Where are the bodies?
That's it! Proof that Valeria missed something. They'll have to listen to you now.
Can you tell me where Lorgan was killed?
Here, we give thanks to Ilmater. Well, we did, until our high priest... Until he...

EditorData.NodeContext: she can't quite get the words out

Text.Value: The temple's not open for public worship right now, sorry. Not until we replace Father Lorgan.

EditorData.NodeContext: pause before "passing" - it should be painful for her to say

Text.Value: Have a look around. If you find something that'll change their mind, they'll be at Sharess' Caress.
Tell Yannis what you've found so far.
By His holy tears... That's - that's terrifying.
Thank you. Now Brilgor's name has been cleared, we can extend our help to the refugees once more.
Investigator Valeria. Used to be on the ball, but this time... I'm unsure.
You must be new here - quite the time to be passing through.
Report this to Investigator Valeria in Sharess' Caress. It's only right they know.
Wish I knew. Not that my opinion matters.
I'm still looking - any advice on where to begin?
Where should I look first?
Who figured that out?
If there are Bhaalists on the loose, Investigator Valeria will want to know. They're at Sharess' Caress right now.
Perhaps I could investigate - make sure nothing was missed?
May Ilmater guide your footfall.
No, sorry, I'll leave you be.
The killing happened in the kitchen cellar. Could be a good place to start.
Lorgan's murderer was a Bhaalist serial killer. I stopped him.
I suppose it's not a surprise that this temple has tunnels underneath - Rivington's chock full of them.
Bhaal's got a bloody history with this city. How exactly does this news make me lucky?
Besides, Brilgor wouldn't know which end to hold the dagger. He's no killer.
You're on the right track. Please, keep looking.
I best get going.
Yes? Can I help you?
You're too late, I'm afraid. The Investigator has been and gone.
In the cellar. You can get down there through Brother Donnick's kitchen. Good luck.
What happened to Father Lorgan?
I scattered his brains across the Lower City cobbles, that's how.
Talking to the victims' corpses was clever, but I don't know if Valeria will accept that testimony.
So what do you think really happened?
Thank you - Ilmater smiles upon us this day. Feel free to look around the temple.
Please, go talk to the Investigator. The sooner we clear Brilgor's name, the better.
You can try. Maybe the Investigator will listen to you.
I need to know where the bodies are.
I want to help you clear Brilgor's name.
Assassins under this temple is certainly unnerving news, thank you for taking care of them.
You're in luck. A Bhaalist serial killer in the Lower City claimed he murdered Lorgan - not this refugee.
Knowledge is power. Also, he's dead.
What doesn't add up?
She's buried in the temple crypt. Passed only last year, poor thing.
The real killer's name was Dolor? Shame we have no hard proof of that.
Here's the murder weapon - it was in some secret tunnels under the temple.
Leave.
Shirra? I can tell you where to find her, but you might find the conversation rather one-sided.
Ilmater grants us small mercies on occasion.
I'm sorry for your loss.
I'm here about Lorgan. I want to solve his murder.
What do I need to prove Brilgor's innocence?
Father Lorgan is on this list of murder targets I found. Looks like more killings are planned.
I need to speak with an initiate of yours - Shirra Clarwen - where is she?
Leave.
One of the refugees - a tiefling called Brilgor - killed Father Lorgan. Allegedly. Doesn't add up to me.

EditorData.NodeContext: she struggles through this, recounting it is very raw still

Text.Value: What do you usually worship here?
He only killed one of your priests, not the entire temple.
Gods... That's worrying. I knew this went deeper than Brilgor and Lorgan.
So there were assassins under the temple working with the real killer? If only we could prove that to Valeria...
Valeria never found the murder weapon - that would be definitive proof that they missed something.
If you can convince them of Brilgor's innocence then... Perhaps Ilmater could shed one less tear this day.

Synopsis:
Dialog with Yannis, one of the priestess of Ilmater. It seems that with father Lorgan dead she took some of his responsibilities.
This dialog is available after you participated in a threeway dialog with her and father Lorgan.
